intro: Zygia hernandezii, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has milky sap, which is a common feature among species in its family. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Zygia hernandezii plays a role in supporting local pollinators, particularly butterflies and bees.
